intro: Cryphiospermum abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian ice plant, is a succulent plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many species adapted to arid environments. The plant features fleshy, blue-green leaves that store water, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for low-maintenance landscaping.
